metadata.title: CVE-2023-0494 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in X.Org. This issue occurs due to a dangling pointer in DeepCopyPointerClasses that can be exploited by ProcXkbSetDeviceInfo() and ProcXkbGetDeviceInfo() to read and write into freed memory. This can lead to local privilege elevation on systems where the X server runs privileged and remote code execution for ssh X forwarding sessions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xnest - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.5
xorg-server-source - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.5
xserver-common - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.5
xserver-xephyr - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.5
xserver-xorg-core - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.5
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.5
xvfb - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

xwayland - 2:22.1.3-2ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> xorg server is actually the xorg-server package the xorg package only contains docs xwayland package contains parts of xorg-server

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.5').
xwayland package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:22.1.3-2ubuntu0.3').
